Reviews.Title: “Poor but functional”
Reviews.Author: marenostrumkk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is by my opinion below 4 stars mainly because room (at least my room - single) is quite small without carpets. My second, and last, critics is about scrambled eggs that are without any taste and look very artificial (breakfast). WiFi access in the room is available but very expensive (appx 6â¬/day) but wired is free with 10 â¬ deposit for cable that is so short that cannot reach from outlet to the bed so I recommend you to take your own long ethernet cable with you. The personal is very polite and friendly and I see this as best point in this hotel. Location is near all metro,bus and train station... Overall, this hotel deserves 3 stars but 4 are way too much in comparison with hotels in some other countries (Ireland, Croatia, Romania, Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Rafaeles Hoteles”
Reviews.Author: Daisy3_Charlie3
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Clean pleasant adequate rooms. I do not agree with the comments about the thin walls and noise. We heard absolutely no noise between rooms. Our last night there was a group of teenage girls who were quite loud in the halls and while we did her them through the door, it was no different than in any other hotel. the staff is very friendly and very helpful. Beautiful courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: BeachLife18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick trip and used priceline "name your own price" and Rafaelhoteles Atacha won the bid. At first impression we were impressed, clean, quiet, and friendly staff. Our room was quiet large and perfect for the little time we spent there. We had the luxury of getting a balcony room on the 4th floor. The view of the Atacha train station was nothing to write home about, but our room had a lock-safe and a good sized bathroom (always a plus)! If we were to rate this hotel on just the hotel, I would have rated it a 4/5 but the location brings it down to a 3/5. At first the location didn't seem like a deal breaker, but a ten minute walk to the Metro, then a 20 minute Metro side to Sol (city center) wasn't ideal. My wife and I don't mind walking and seeing the non-tourist way of life, but every minute counts when your on vacation. A hotel located closer to Sol would have made the trip just a little better. I felt as if this hotel was very American, when I travel to Spain I want to experience the full Spanish culture! For a hotel close to the Atacha train station, this would be great. If you want to be right in the heart of Madrid I would recommend staying a little bit closer to Sol!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms with limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sukhen Kumar s
Reviews.Content: stayed for two days with my wife,rooms were small with uncomfortale bed.we barely managed to sleep.it has nothing much to offer.breakfast was just ok. poor room service.would not like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff; Location Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dadoc001
Reviews.Content: Spent a day at this hotel while in Madrid. The staff were very friendly overall - at checkin and checkout. It is in the old part of Madrid, but not very convenient from a practical point of view. It is near to the Atocha station - but getting to a metro can be a good few minutes walk, which takes the charm away from being in the old town area. The room was pretty good, and other than the location, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “hotel for new year 2012”
Reviews.Author: sinisa13
Reviews.Content: We spent Nee Year in Madrid and were situated in Rafael Atocha Hotel. It is nice hotel near main railway station and its not so far from Puerta del Sol, main Madrid square, but anyway you have to take taxi. Its very important that metro station is across the hotel and from that point you can get anywhere that you want, as well all over the Spain. Accommodation is nice, breakfast we never tried because we came with target to have good night life. For sure Madrid has it!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: S022
Reviews.Content: Good hotel overall with a modern feel. We had chose to stay close to the Atocha train station, so this location was great. To visit Puerto del Sol, the walk was about 20 minutes but lots to see along the way. The Metro is a good option and easily accessible from the hotel. Museo del Prado is a very close walk as is the Reina Sofia. The staff was very helpful, especially Jesus. The room was spacious and clean w/comfortable bed. Breakfast was not included and would've been a nice touch. Definitely would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “neat but distant”
Reviews.Author: Debo6
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very neat and clean with a you would expect. the bar was a nice place to rest. the breaky was awesome. it had food to suit everyone including gluten free dishes. The bad things about this hotel is it is a far hike to the main city. Actually, the place feels deserted with no shopping and 1 or 2 resturants which were barley open. the train station is opposite but we were told not to catch the train at night. the other thing we found, over two stays at this hotel during our tour is the people on the front desk were not very helpful. it seemed they didnt want to go out of their way to help you. they never smiled no matter how nice you were to them. everything i asked for eg internet access seemed a hassle to them to help me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: starizer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 6 blocks from the nearest metro (Palos de la Frontera) and also close to the Atocha station (same station for RENFE) in case you are coming/going to other cities. The area was quite deserted; didn't see too much ppl. But we didn't feel unsafe though if you are a single female traveler I wouldn't recommend. Our room was much nicer than I expected. Very clean and modern looking. The room was spacious enough to easily move around. There was a flat screen TV, mini fridge, safe and hair dryer. The bed was firm and clean so was able to sleep well. Pillow was flat but if you fluff it up it was usable. Bathroom was spacious and shower pressure was good. The bathtub is noticeable high so be careful getting in and out, but good thing they have a rubber mat on the bathtub floor. Also, there is a lift in this hotel. Overall a nice modern and clean place to stay esp. for the price. Also, on the street behind the hotel there is a decent Italian restaurant (Gino). it was the only thing close by and still open over Easter holiday.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aline S
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, good rooms, you need to walk 10 minutes to get to any of the main attrations (at least the ones i went to), good breakfast (but you need to go early if you don´t want to stay in line!).

Reviews.Title: “Short weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Craig J
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i went to Madrid for a short weekend break (valentines) and found the whole weekend most enjoyable. The Rafael Atocha hotel was located in the south of the city not within walking distance of the main attractions but right next to the Atocha Renfe Train/Tube station. The Hotel itsself was very well maintained and extremely clean. The staff were very pleasent and very professional. We opted for room and breakfast and experienced the usual continental breakfast. It was well cooked and very fresh. Saturday was fine with plenty of space in the dining room but Sunday was extremely busy and we had to wait for approx 10 mins to be seated. However this is the only slight grumble on what was an otherwise excellent experience. The room was excellent, very spacious and cleaned regularly by the cleaners. The cleaners however need to be aware of the noise they make when cleaning as we were woke both mornings by the cleaning carts being dragged across the wooden floors by loudly shouting cleaners. When we checked out we asked to leave our bags as our flight was not until later that evening and the receptionists allowed us to do this without issue. All in all a fantastic experience and all the staff at the Rafael Atocha should be proud of their efforts as we both really enjoyed our stay. Madrid is a fantastic city, we did not see half of what we wanted to see (with only 2 full days there) and will definitely be returning to see the rest, and we would definitely return to the Rafael Atocha as it was a most pleasent hotel to stay in. Craig and Niamh - Feb 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE N
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice hotel.Good location,you can visit by foot all tourists attractions.If i come again to Madrid i will stay again to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Zapo02
Reviews.Content: The hotel very close to Atocha station and is within walking distance. However, when one has a lot of luggage it's a bit of a trek to get to the actual terminal (entrance/exit/ticketing/shoping section). It didn't bother me a great deal. The stay was nice, front desk was very professional in my opinion, and overall, I enjoyed the experience. I would stay there again. I traveled for business and was satisfied with the internet connection and the attention given in providing information for my commute and public trans tips. Wifi wasn't free but wired internet was.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Panic”
Reviews.Author: PowersLakeTraveler
Reviews.Content: When we were awarded this hotel, on one of the websites that doesn't reveal the name, we were quite upset as we looked at the reviews. At first, the location of the hotel is perceived as horrible, but after a few days, it really grew on our family. It is not a 4 star, as most of the hotels in Madrid bill themselves, I am not sure any of them truly are. The hotel was clean, the beds are ok, bathrooms are tiled. I would say this hotel is more of a Holiday Inn Express or Hampton Inn type quality, fine for the price. If you stay, bring toiletries, as the only bath product is an all in one shower gel. Ask for a room in the back of the hotel, as the main road in front is very noisy if the windows are open. Use either Metro stop at Delicias or Palos de la Frontera, both are quick walks (8 minutes) and can take you right up to Sol. If traveling in from the airport, use the Renfe it is about 2 Euro each and runs right to Delicias. Stay away from the restaurant down the street, it is not busy for a reason, food is ok, but prices are out of line compared to other places. You must stop at Bodega Rosell which is on General Lacy and 5 minutes from the Hotel. Tapas are extrordinary and prices are great, we spent 65 and 85 Euros, for family of four, the two times we were there (two bottles of wine the one night). No free wifi in hotel but with ethernet cord you can get access, no luck if you have Ipad. Overall, good hotel for the price, nice neighborhood as you head west, and not full of tourist shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not much for the money.”
Reviews.Author: dpmason
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel four nights at the end of a long trip around Andalucia. It is registered as a four-star hotel, but really it should be three. In other words, ok but not great. The rooms are warm and clean, but the beds are on the poorer-end. The amenities are basic, and the desk staff so-so in providing assistance. No free wi-fi, but you can ask for a free ethernet cable at the front desk to plug into their server. Many visitors have complained about thin walls - it's about par-for-the-course in bigger/older hotels, but one thing that I found "amusing" was the cleaning staff starts early (8am) and are not sensitive about being quiet. A lot of banging, loud talking, etc. The restaurant's prices are not excessive, and we used our mini-bar fridge to store left-overs. The closest metro stop is 5-10 min walk away, and you are only three stops from the center of town (a 5 min ride or so), and a couple blocks from the bars, supermarket and restaurants/bodegas frequented by the neighborhood folks (i.e. not touristy). The Atocha Train Station, Prado and Royal Gardens are about a mile walk up the street on a straight shot. However, if you want to be in the hustle and bustle of the main parts of town (Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Chueca, etc) you should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: Ejmoore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, 10 minute walk from the Atocha train station which you can get to from the airport. For those complaining of walking far distances i wouldnt consider a 10 minute walk to parks and museums that much..especially in such a lovely city with so much culture to see! We stayed in Madrid 5 days and visited the Prado museum, reina sofia art museum, the botanical garden, retiro park and the main area Sol which i recommend to go and see the palace and cathedral there (you can get there via the atocha train station, 4 stops to sol station, or if you dont mind walking its about half an hour/40 minutes away with shops on the way). The hotel itself is very nice for what we paid. Breakfast is the usual toast, cereal, bacon egg toast cheese etc. The rooms are spacious enough for what you want because who stays in their room all day? Bathroom very nice with clean towels every day if you want them. All the staff are very nice and reception gave us a map to get around the city. The only negative of the hotel would be the thin walls. On one strange occasion after falling off to sleep we were woken up by a loud talking man giving people flute lessons at 12 oclock at night!! (the previous night he ran a bath at 5 in the morning and you could hear exactly what he was saying!) However, I would still recommend this hotel to everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “nice room but long walk to anything”
Reviews.Author: praha13
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and nicely furnished. It was heated well, that was important because it was cold outside.The staff was polite and helpful. However, be prepared for a long walk to the center of town. And its a ten minute walk to the metro. Also a minimum ten minute walk to the nearest cafe or grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “between average and very good. good”
Reviews.Author: mardinijr
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good. staff are very helpful with maps n directions where to go and what to do. but the hotel, a communisim style building is over rated for 4 stars. 3 is pretty good the rooms are spacious and so is the bathroom. both are clean and has a minibar which many hotels in the same category throughout europe dont have. its location is terrible. a 10 min walk from the train station. which makes a burden on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel but a bit far”
Reviews.Author: Bole365
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, with pleasant service who speak fluent English but not really close to anything. 15 min walk to Reina Sofia museum and Atocha station. Try walking that 5 times a day just to get to the first cafe and you'll see what I mean. At Reina Sofia cafe there is free wifi access since it is not free in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: akb2010
Reviews.Content: Generally, a good enough hotel especially if you're just looking for a place to sleep for a night or two, but not the best choice for a long-stay tourist or someone looking for a lot of services. Location is very good--close to public transport, Prado not too far to walk, restaurants nearby--and rooms are good sized. Rooms are a little dated--carpet worn, bathrooms could use modernization, but nothing too bad and everything was clean and servicable. Acceptable, without being stellar. Biggest point of weakness is the front desk. They're not particularly helpful or friendly--not rude and not a reason to avoid the hotel, but if you're looking for a lot of insight or assistance from hotel staff, you'll likely be disappointed. We had only one request while we were there--asked for the location of a pizza place near the hotel. First place they gave us was closed at the time we asked (early afternoon a lot of places in madrid close). Second place was a good 20 minutes away and we passed 3 other places (which turned out to be better) on the way. I understand that pizza isn't the number one request they get but there didn't seem to be a huge emphasis on advice or concierge services. Want to reiterate this wasn't a problem for us and we'd stay here again (price is good) but if you're looking for a lot of assistance or if it's your first time in europe, don't speak spanish etc, there are probably better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Just average.”
Reviews.Author: mbkris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our initial tour with Trafalgar. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It located close to the train station, but far from the city center and all the good eats. When we arrived we asked from some where to eat and ended up walking away from the city center and got annoyed from several of the places since we only spoke english and ended up heading back to our room until meeting the rest of our group. I thought the hotel was very basic and was very disappointed in the cost for Wi-Fi, we thought it was over priced. I thought the walls were very thin, my room was located very close to the elevator and I could hear people coming and going all night.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel all that you need when spending a few days in Madrid :-)”
Reviews.Author: leriche
Reviews.Content: WE were well impressed with the hotel, lovely clean room, excellent garden seating area, friendly staff, food was good but could be warmer & coffe is cold but if you ask a waiter/waitress will instantly return with hot coffee. We only stayed inmadrid for 2 days so this hotel had plenty for us..............

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Benzi-R
Reviews.Content: It is not the best location, but almost. It is 30 minute walk to the center of Madrid. It is 15 minutes from Museo dela Reina Sofia, where Picasso's Guernica is in permanent exhibit and the Atocha Madrid's main train station station. There is a taxi station right next to the hotel and with 5 Euros you can get to the center within 10 minutes or less. The hotel itself is clean, the lobby is pleasant. We had a very good deal. I don't know if this is normal, when all the hotel closer to the center were completely fully booked and the 4 stars charged over $250 a night, we paid $100 (80 Euros). The room doesn't have the normal amenities I am used to for a 4 star hotel. They don't have tissue paper in the toilet, but they do have a very good cable internet - good for laptops but they don't have WiFi. We never ate at the hotel, so I don't know how is their restaurant, but there are many good restaurants around within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business - type hotel”
Reviews.Author: krc11
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed here for one night before we left on the train to Barcelona. It was a large, very nice business-type hotel. Our room was modern and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and assisted us in looking up our correct train departure time. Free wifi. There was a cool little restaurant around the block and seemed like it was in the middle of apartment complexes and was like a dog park! it was fun and very laid back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and functional”
Reviews.Author: FlightlessParrot
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant modern hotel, conveniently located to the Atocha Station and the Prado. We had one night in Madrid, and our travel agent booked us here to make travelling convenient, and it does that. It's walking distance to the amazing and wonderful Atocha rail station, though it's a rather long walk in summer with baggage. It's a slightly longer walk to the Prado, and we had just enough time to do that and spend time in cool looking at a few paintings from an amazing collection. The hotel itself is very standard, but good. Modern clean lines, excellent standards of maintenance and cleanliness, helpful front desk staff. Rooms big and comfortable, except that the blinds in our room weren't especially good at keeping the light out. They charge for WiFi, like a wounded bull. The restaurant produced pretty good food, once we discovered they were serving in the garden. Which would have been superb, except for the wasps that wanted to share our meal. I think you can do things to repel wasps, can't you? If you want a hotel of this sort in this part of town, this will do very well.

Reviews.Title: “Difference between being part of a tour group and staying on your own”
Reviews.Author: CndnGuider
Reviews.Content: Breakfast for non tour guests is great, for tour groups, not so great. We could hardly believe the difference. Soggy scrambled eggs, not much fresh fruit. Some of the reception staff was fantastic in giving you directions on how to get to different parts of town and others could not be bothered to give you the time of the day. Hotel recommended a restaurant for dinner that was not so great. The staff at the restaurant gave great service to locals but not to the tourists. A bottle of water was 6.5E. Ouch.

Reviews.Title: “Who would rate this hotel a 4 star?”
Reviews.Author: beachiechick
Reviews.Content: Away from everything Rooms very small Mold in bathroom restaurants all closed in the evening surrounding hotel Restaurant in hotel more expensive that hotel stay for one Parking over 22 Euros for one night Internet not working - including lobby computer "out of service" sign was displayed

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: academy53
Reviews.Content: No soundproofing whatever between bedrooms or corridors. Conversation in one room heard two rooms away. No tea or coffee facilities in rooms. As they advertise, it is 'at the end of the cultural mile' - and then some more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jraf07
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for your money and a good location away from the hustle and bustle (i.e. noise) but close to metro and a not-too-far walk to most things. It is a hotel that seems to host large groups, which can be a little noisy when trying to sleep, if you are sensitive to that. Very clean, comfortable, fairly spacious rooms. Staff is nice but not as helpful and knowledgable as they could be, maybe it's a language barrier issue. We found some information/deals on our own that we had asked the hotel staff about and they were not aware or not sharing the information. Rooms are simple, no coffee makers, tissue, or many extras but there is a hairdryer, shampoo/soap dispenser, glasses, television, etc. The breakfast buffet is excellent, but not cheap (12 euros), however it's included with cost of room on weekends/special deals. They are amenable to giving hot water for tea in the room, but do not have this available outside the buffet hours. The hotel's internet is really expensive, there is a super cheap place a few blocks away and also you can find WAY better deals on wine, food, everything outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cortecera
Reviews.Content: the room we had was absolutely nothing like the pictures!!!! perhaps we were given one of the older unrenovated rooms but it was an absolute disappointment to see a small old room with dirty worn down carpeting, curtains in a florid design from decades ago, old furniture and bathroom...definitely not worth the price.. long walk to the train station, not very well located. staff are okay but i disliked the fact they doubted my pre-paid booking and wanted a payment from me.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: busytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and myself and a few colleagues were expecting more from the look of it on their website. A colleague stayed at another Rafaelhoteles hotel in Spain but unfortunately this one didn't live up to that reputation. The room I was in was basic and you can tell they tried to flash it up with newer furniture, but the finish and general paintwork was poor in some places. I wouldn't class it's location as 'excellent' as it says on it's website - definately not. An average hotel at an average price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with no frills”
Reviews.Author: Pykmin
Reviews.Content: Getting there from the airport is OK, we have used the metro as the Spanish lines are superb. A bit tricky if you get there by the Atocha station as there's a ramp, then a U-turn, and the street to get there is not very well-lit and it's deserted (we arrived late at night). Staff was helpful and got us an Internet cable and adaptor when asked (a refoudable deposit was asked). When we asked for a taxi they advised us to wait outside and we didn't wait long for a taxi to show up. The hotel rooms are large and clean and look more modern than the corridor, where we have spotted a stain on the carpet, which didn't bother us at all by the way. The room had a view on a wall, but we didn't bother either. The general impression is that the hotel looks oldish in the common areas (breakfast area, lounge, etc.) and new/refurbished in the rooms. Breakfast was included with bacon, eggs, hams, cheese, vegs, yogurts, fruits, it was quite rich I must say. Overall it was a pleasant stay, the hotel is good located (a few metro stops from city centre) and would advise it.

Reviews.Title: “average-nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SBTPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: My trip was business and I traveled alone. I felt safe walking around what appeared to be a residential neighborhood, but would not venture out by myself after dark. Therefore, I ate at the hotel restaurant for dinner every nite. The downside to this is the restaurant does not start serving until 8:30 p.m. The food was average & expensive. Not much to do if you're on foot. There's a large department store (similar to Macy's) about 15-20 minutes down the street. I didnt find all of the staff to be very accomodating. Felt the staff's English was fair at best and my Spanish is not that good, even though I did my best. The comfort of the room was average however, the shower did not work well in my room. Internet service was via cable as WiFi was expensive. The cable was about 15 inches long so you are basically stuck at the working area. No clocks or time pieces through out the hotel. One TV channel in English which was CNN. Walls are thin and heard lots of noise late at night within the hotel corridors. Needless to say, a couple of sleepless nights.

Reviews.Title: “Booking if you dont mind a good walk”
Reviews.Author: jetsetcouple
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on a "secret hotel" on late rooms and looking at the map didn't think it was too far out of the city centre. However after getting off at the Metro station the hotel is still a good 15-20 minute walk away. Our first room was very dated and smelt awful, but when we returned to the front desk staff were very helpful and gave us a new modern room straight away. The room itself was huge, but the bed was hard and the water pressure in the shower almost a trickle. I wouldn't recommend the hotel to anyone else unless you are using the train station which the location is perfect for. There are better more central hotels for the same price you can pay for this one!

Reviews.Title: “This was an excellent hotel for two weary travelers.”
Reviews.Author: marciaDanville
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Rafaelhoteles Atocha, Madrid. The front desk staff was very efficient ; Adrian was especially helpful with a recommendation of a travel agency and other questions I had. He was very polished, professional, and personable in his interaction with me. We appreciated his expertise and assistance even though he was off duty for the day and remained a little longer to answer my questions. Sincerely, Marcia Stewart

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Put on your Walking Shoes”
Reviews.Author: salsasenora
Reviews.Content: The Rafaelhoteles Atocha was included in our tour itinerary for our first night in Spain. The main thing you must know is that you have at least 30 minutes walk to the Atocha metro/train station and the nearest concentration of cafes and shops, 45 minutes walk to El Prado and other museums. There are many similarly priced hotels with better locations. First the positives: The staff was very friendly and accommodating; just around the corner are a mini-market for reasonable wine, snacks and water, a currency exchange, and a decent Chinese restaurant. Rooms are OK, with nice shampoo/gel dispenser, bath sheets, safe deposit box and comfortable beds. Like most hotels in Spain, some amenities lacking such as sufficient hangers, Kleenex, ice machines,washclothes, pen/pad. Tub was so narrow that you can hardly stand on flat surface to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nancyb926
Reviews.Content: Quite a distance to the sights of Madrid, this hotel is situated approx 15 minutes by foot to the nearest Metro and Atocha train station. The twin bedded room was adequate for two people. Nothing special about this hotel except for the courtyard view, which I requested in advcance to avoid facing the busy street . Food was fair at best, scrambled eggs salty, cold and soaking wet both days, little overall variety of food selection. Internet available for 8 euros for 45 minutes. Staff courteous with fair command of English.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you have no problem walking”
Reviews.Author: RichoSunderland
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through the 'Top Secret Hotels' route and found the hotel itself to be very good - clean, spacious with helpful and efficient staff. No complaints about the room which was more than adequate although the view was only over the railway lines. There is a small pleasant courtyard to sit outside and the lobby and bar area are pleasant. However, as has been pointed out it isn't the most accessible hotel from public transport and even you don't mind a good walk, as we do, it got a bit monotonous going up and down the same road nearly every time we went out even cutting through the impressive hall of the train station. If you don't mind walking then it's not really far to the Museum Mile and the fantastic Parque del Retiro. The Prado offers free entry on certain days after 6pm (open until 8pm) but it's not really a secret so expect long queues. Madrid itself is a lovely city and if you can manage the walk into the centre you'll probably find it quite rewarding (if not a little tiring in the heat of early summer). It probably just lacks a signature building that is instantly recognisable. Although the Metro is useful if you need it, it often requires changes to get where you want as it seems aimed more at the Madrilenos than any tourist trails (which is ok) and it can be a bit of a drag (literally) to get your luggage from the airport to the hotel and vice versa. A taxi to the airport would be very expensive I would guess. There were a few places to eat round about but obviously the proximity to the train station meant a lot of it was fast food (whether Spanish style or burgers, etc.) until you were a bit further away. Overall, good value but take some comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff, location not bad”
Reviews.Author: BSM001
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a Priceline bid of $55/night. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful, too. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from two different Metro stations, so if you're looking for something in the middle of all the action and nightlife Madrid has to offer, this isn't the place. You can also walk to the Prado, Gran Via and many other hot spots in 10 minutes or less. WiFi in the hotel is spotty and I found myself sitting in a stairwell or the hotel lobby. The "gym" is basically a small room with a treadmill, bike, stairmaster and a non-functioning multi-purpose machine. Goood for a quick cardio workout, but if you need more, find a real gym. Bed was also a bit hard, but after a night of partying in Madrid, you'll be too tired to notice. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, but doubt I'd spend more than what I bid on this.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: rayoflightcanada
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel as part of Trafalgar tour for 2 nights, the hotel is far away from all attractions, the walls are thin and you can hear the elevator and other tenants flushing their toilets or taking shower, first night me and other travelers could not sleep till 4 am in the morning as there was a private function and the sound of music was so loud that you can hear it in your room. Rooms were big and clean, no English channels in the hotel except you cant sleep at night because of noise. You can walk to Prado museum from hotel and there is a train station at the end of street, if you wan to walk to the plaza mayor you need 30-40 minutes or taxi will be expensive. Breakfast room was fiasco, food as terrible and above all you have to queue for 30 minutes to get something to eat. Reception staff was helpful as when I checked in my room has cigarette smell so I asked to change my room and they helped me ride away otherwise it will be another nightmare. I would never stay here again but I did not have a choice as already booked part of my tour package.

Reviews.Title: “Bad All Around”
Reviews.Author: CoolBreeze2010
Reviews.Content: The location is terrible, the rooms are bland and the service leaves much to be desired. I stayed at this hotel on a weeklong business trip and were it not for the cancellation fine, would have left immediately. My room's ceiling had clear water damage and was falling apart. I was woken up by the cleaning staff walking through the halls screaming at each other at 8AM daily - even on the weekend. Also, the free Internet access requires you to have a cable - I don't know many business travelers who carry one of these anymore. Metro stops and Retiro Park are within walking distance, but the area of town you have to walk through feels a little sketchy. You can find better - don't settle on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...if you enjoy long walks”
Reviews.Author: poddyser
Reviews.Content: Firstly, a quick moan about lastminute.com. We booked this hotel through lastminute.com's "Top Secret Hotels" promotion, the first time using this method. Described as a "Centrally located hotel in front of Atocha Station" we figured this was a decent location and price for a 4* hotel on our first visit to Madrid (got it for around £300 for 5 nights stay). We were wrong! The hotel certainly overlooks the train lines but is easily a 15-20min walk from the entrance to the front door of Atocha train station and, all in all, about 25mins to Atocha subway station which we used to get around the city. However, even though mainly a business-orientated hotel, the accommodation itself was excellent and offered great comfort after a long hard day sightseeing etc. Probably the biggest bed I have ever slept in. Overall, a nice hotel but not ideal if you want to be near the action in Madrid. Pay the extra 30 euro or whatever and stay somewhere nearer the centre. Nice hotel, poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near station, boring rooms, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Xenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night near the station Atocha. Neighbourhood wasn't nice, rooms were boring. Staff was very friendly and the breakfast was great. The hotel was convenient for us but I wouldn't stay here for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel just find the right metro station”
Reviews.Author: Oz2_10
Reviews.Content: I got stuck with this hotel through priceline and was worried when I read the reviews on here. The hotel itself is fine, the rooms were quite nice, very clean and the bed comfy. We caught the metro from the airport and got off at the Atocha station. I thought the reviews were right when the cab took 10 minutes to get to the hotel. But the reception staff informed us that the closest station was actually Palos de la frontera which is only a 5 minute quick, flat walk. From this station it's only 3 stops to Sol, the main city centre stop. It rained the whole time we were there and we even dragged our 3 suitcases to this metro station to catch it back to the airport and honestly it was totally fine. We walked back from the metro at night and did not have any problems. From the hotel you can walk around 10 minutes to get to the reina sofia museum and then about 10 minutes into town. There was also a great little patisserie around the corner at the back of the hotel across from a cute cafe. We actually found the hotel quite convenient and I imagine staying around puerta del sol would be pretty noisy, whilst we had great sleeps. Free wifi in the room was also a good bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: kingrk2
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. This place was in a weird area and not convienent to the metro station. The 'non-smoking' room that we had absolutely reeked of smoke. I spent one night in this particular room and woke up naseous and with a headache. We asked for a new room in the morning. They were pleasant and move our luggage to a new room that afternoon. We were moved to the room right next to the elevator with a different and slightly less unnerving smell. The rooms themselves were stark and cold. A hardwood floor with a cement stucco wall. No warmth at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,nice hotel, but a way to walk to Metro station”
Reviews.Author: storminflyer
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews about the hotel and the area and was concerned when my bid on Priceline was accepted. After staying there, I have no issues with the hotel or area. The hotel staff was helpful and I found the hotel to be clean and safe. The area is fine and I had no issues walking at night with my teenage daughter. I would suggest using Google Earth to get familiar with the area. Close to the Prado and Reina musuems (10-15 minute walk). There is fast food about a 10-12 minute walk (McDonald's, Burger King). The Metro is about a 10-12 minute walk (you can walk through the Atocha train station). The hotel breakfast is very good (12 Euros). The rooms were clean, a little noisy though if your room is on the street side. There is one English speaking tv station in the room (CNN). High speed internet is free if you have your own computer that can plug in. If you use wifi there is a fee. I would have no issues staying at this hotel again, the only issue is that it is a hike to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A regular option”
Reviews.Author: pmp007
Reviews.Content: Located a walking distance from main train station, this hotel is a better option for business travellers rather than for tourists. My room was located on the 1st floor near metting rooms so at 7 am i would hear some noise from the hotel staff preparing the room for meetings. The room is confortable, the bathroom what you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/No easy access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: We stayed here first 2 nights as part of the Trafalgar Wonders of Spain Tour. Nice hotel with very friendly staff. The surrounding area is nice also, some nice cafes (towards the train station, take the second left), nearby ATMs, and even some nice small shops. Within walking distance to Atocha train station and museums. Only problem we had was finding the Metro to downtown Madrid where it was much more lively. We never found the Metro at the Atocha train station, but there was one in the other direction. We also were there on a Sunday when lots of things were closed. Would really have preferred to stay closer to downtown (i.e., near Plaza Major).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - mainly for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: marko1979
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with decent rooms. It's a real business hotel. Hardly any attention of staff. I paid 70 euro per night via priceline.com. Breakfast is 15 euro, but also nice bakery around the corner where you can get a coffea and croissant. About 8 minute walk to nearest metro station. 30 minute walk to Sol. The neighbourhood is a residential area and in my opinion safe to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Scary neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rafael Atocha while on our Trafalgar tour of Spain. We found the rooms to be clean and fine,but the street that you have to walk along past some very scary and seedy people to get to the centre of town is very intimidating. I was nervous as well as my husband and our four friends. The hotel staff wasn't very friendly and barely made eye contact even though I made a big effort to speak in Spanish. I would not recommend this hotel for a single woman!! And I would not recommend Madrid either. I had my wallet stolen from my purse while walking in broad daylight with my husband and friends and never felt a thing. I have travelled extensively through Europe but have never experience anything like the nervousness I felt while walking the streets of Madrid.Madrid is mad with pick pockets. I know they are everywhere,but Spain has a serious problem beyond reason. It's like walking the streets with rats all around you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, the rest is quite bad though.”
Reviews.Author: Jujuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night during a business trip in Spain in July 2008. I chose this hotel because it was quite near the train station Atocha and I needed to leave quite early in the morning by train. However, once there I realised that it was a good 20mn walk from the station, I do not advise you to try it in summer heat with your luggage unless you are quite fit. It is also quite far from the city centre so it is not the ideal spot for tourists. The room was nice, spacious and clean, and generally confortable. It was not cheap but worth the money. However the staff was unfriendly and not helpful at all. In the evening, I thought it would be more convenient for me to eat at the hotel restaurant, unfortunately the food was disgusting and quite expensive, and I could not eat half of my meal even if I was quite hungry. The worst of all was the dessert, a cream cake that had not seen a fridge for several hours! Even if the experience was not a disaster, I think I will try to book another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the luxury”
Reviews.Author: Redus
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impresessed with this hotel. Okay it is a short walk from the centre of Madrid but there is a taxi rank right outside where you can jump in and spend less than 6 Euros goin to any part of the old town. I do not agree that the rooms were "spartan" as the previous review stated. In fact we were impressed with the decor and comfort of the spacious room-certainly not what we were expecting having stayed in other Italian cities. It is classed as UK 3 Star but I think it is more like 4 star. Excellent Vlaue fo what we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: newbury2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in Madrid on business. The hotel is within walking distance of the city centre and the rooms are all clean and comefortable with a modern look and feel. As a business visitor I had no complaints. If travelling to Madrid as a tourist I imagine that this hotel would be quite expensive and better value could be found elsewhere which is why I'd rate this with 3/5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but the staff sucks”
Reviews.Author: i-gots-wanderlust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The staff are unfriendly and sometimes even downright rude. They weren't helpful when I asked about the nearest metro stop or local stores/restaurants. The room was bigger than expected (I had a single room) and the bathroom was clean. The only redeeming quality for this hotel is that it's in a quiet neighborhood and within walking distance to the three major art museums in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: travel55
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad, but the staff at the front desk and during breakfast is unexperienced and not friendly at all. During breakfast you may observe the very young and untrained staff. Their fingers are in their hair, nose, ears, mouth ... and seconds later they touch the plates... Some cups were not clean, we asked for a change. They were changed but without any apology. Avoid room 425, were it sounds like a waterfall when it is raining. A constant noise which is really distubing. Over all not a very good experience, which is a pity, because the rooms are nice and the breakfast variety is great.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chazman99
Reviews.Content: Apparently customer service is not important at this property. I was part of a 40 person tour group that stayed here on Oct 06 and Oct 07. The hotel A/C was shut off and room temp was 80 degrees. Reason told to us and our tour director was that a number of guests complained that it was too cold. Each room had a thermostat with adjustable controls for the temperature so that resaon was a total lie . Front desk staff stated that the manager made the decision and that he was off for the weekend and could not be contacted. They suggest that we open the windows. The hotel had a wedding party that spilled out to the terrace below many of our open windows, firecrackers exploding at 12:30 a.m., alot of noisy attendees,etc. Also the t.v. was small and pracatically mounted on the ceiling...difficult to watch. Breakfast buffet was good,hotel location is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, except for location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, except that several of its front office staff do not speak or understand English properly. As well, one cannot get a tour planned at this hotel. Hotel and rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our tour group stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our Highlights of Spain and Portugal tour. Both mornings the hotel was very unreliable with wake up calls. It was either too early, too late or not at all according to the tourists I talked with. The breakfast was nice BUT the hot food was served much later than the cold selections, and was not even hot! Tables were not cleared and set quickly enough, a lack of sufficient staff. Our room phone was not working and service responded 6 hours later. Our room safe was locked in the open position, and although reported on the first day, service did not arrive to correct the situation. The hotel is clean and nicely appointed but located a little distant from the main attractions other than the museum, and required some form of public transit to reach most of the favoured sites like the Plaza Mayor neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Hotels website for the amazing price of $90 / night (taxes included). The hotel is terrific, with clean attractive public spaces, and a great room with brand new beds and a very nice bathroom. Hotel restaurant was also very nice and a good bargain. Breakfast buffet was 10 euros and good. Hotel in rather sterile section of town, but only a pleasant 15 minute walk to Prado museums.

HotelInfo.Name: Rafaelhoteles Atocha
HotelInfo.Address: Mendez Alvaro 30, 28045 Madrid, Spain
